author: cnbc.com
title: The Trade Desk: 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
VENTURA, Calif. (AP) _ The Trade Desk Inc. (TTD) on Thursday reported first-quarter net income of $9.1 million.
On a per-share basis, the Ventura, California-based company said it had net income of 20 cents. Earnings, adjusted for stock option expense, came to 34 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 10 cents per share.
The digital-advertising platform operator posted revenue of $85.7 million in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $73.4 million.
For the current quarter ending in July, The Trade Desk said it expects revenue in the range of $103 million.
The company expects full-year revenue of $433 million.
The Trade Desk shares have climbed 15 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, shares hit $52.73, a climb of 32 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on TTD at https://www.zacks.com/ap/TTD
